text: Antanas Valionis (born September 21, 1950) is a Lithuanian politician, currently a member of the New Union party. He was appointed the Lithuanian Minister of Foreign Affairs on October 30, 2000, and reappointed on July 5, 2001. Resigned on August 31, 2006. From 1981 he served in the Soviet secret police KGB in Riga reaching the rank of captain.https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/lithuanian-archive- releases-kgb-collaborator-names-15767072http://www.komentaras.lt/?p=15945 ==External links== *Antanas Valionis, the Soviet KGB Captain in reserve ==References== Category:1950 births Category:KGB officers Category:Lithuanian communists Category:Living people Category:Ministers of Foreign Affairs of Lithuania Category:Recipients of the Order of the Cross of Terra Mariana, 1st Class Category:Ambassadors of Lithuania to Poland Category:Ambassadors of Lithuania to Bulgaria Category:21st-century Lithuanian politicians
title: Antanas Valionis
